Browse your Google Drive folders in a hierarchical tree structure. Select a folder to see its files, then upload directly to that specific folder.

‚ú® New Features

  • Hierarchical folder tree structure
  • Expand/collapse folder navigation
  • Folder selection with visual feedback
  • Upload to specific selected folders
  • Two-panel layout (folders + files)
  • Parent-child relationship visualization

üéØ How to Use

1. Navigate folders: Click the ‚ñ∂ arrows to expand/collapse folders and see their children

2. Select a folder: Click on any folder name to select it (highlighted in black)

3. Upload files: Once a folder is selected, click "Upload to [folder name]" button

4. View files: Selected folder's files appear in the right panel

5. Search: Use search bar to find files across all folders
